business.headline: Explained: Why Bharti Airtel shares are down 3% todayBharti Airtel share price: Around 3.5 crore shares, equal to nearly 0.6% of Airtel's equity, were traded at Rs 2,108 apiece in the block deal window.
Sensex opens nearly 200 points up, Nifty above 25,900; Airtel down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex added 274.90 points to 84,861.91, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 83.25 points to 25,968.05 as of 9:28 am.

Sudeep Pharma IPO allotment today: Step-by-step status check and listing dateThe three-day subscription window, which closed on November 25, saw the IPO race towards nearly 100 times subscription, reflecting strong interest across investor categories.

Excelsoft Technologies IPO listing today: Will the stock open higher or lower?The allotment of shares was completed on November 24, and with the kind of subscription numbers the company has posted, many retail investors are hoping for a firm opening on the exchanges.

Tata Motors may hike prices early next quarterChandra said Tata Motors currently holds 16–17 per cent share in the SUV segment, and the Sierra is expected to lift this to 20–25 per cent once fully ramped up.

India's November Russian oil imports set to hit 5-month high amid US tariffsIndia, the world's third-largest oil importer, has been the biggest buyer of discounted seaborne Russian crude after Russia was shunned by Western countries following its 2022 invasion of Ukraine.
Sensex closes 314 points lower, Nifty below 26,000; Infosys down 1%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 313.70 points to close at 84,587.01, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 74.70 points to end at 25,884.80.

Do new Labour Codes hit Narayana Murthy's 9-9-6 dreams?India's new Labour Codes cap workweeks at 48 hours, with flexibility on scheduling, overtime pay, and a mandatory day of rest. But as industry leaders like Narayana Murthy push for 72-hour weeks and L&T's SN Subrahmanyan praises 90-hour schedules, many are raising questions whether these reforms will hold ground in a culture where overwork is routine.

Waiting for your IPO to list? Here's how opening price on markets is decidedMost retail investors have little idea how the opening price for an IPO is decided. They often rely on grey market premium (GMP), hype, and subscription figures to guess the listing level, even though none of these factors directly set the price.

Do the new labour codes put full-time jobs at risk?Fixed-term jobs just got a major boost under the new labour codes. But does this new flexibility mean full-time roles are at risk, or will companies find a new balance altogether?

India–US trade deal looks quiet. The 'energy' shift tells another storyIndia and the US may look stalled on a formal trade deal, but shifting oil flows, a major LPG pact and calibrated tariff moves show the real progress is happening quietly behind the scenes.
Sensex opens 100 points lower, Nifty below 26,000; Infosys down 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 16.48 points to 84,884.23, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 4.55 points to 25,954.95 as of 9:28 am.

Sudeep Pharma IPO closes today: Is it worth a bid? Check the GMPThe Rs 895-crore IPO includes a fresh issue of Rs 95 crore and an offer for sale worth Rs 800 crore. The price band is set at Rs 563 to Rs 593 per share, and the minimum investment for retail buyers is Rs 14,825.
Apple layoff: Tech giant cuts jobs across sales team, says reportApple said it is reducing roles across its sales teams as part of a plan to improve how it engages with customers.
Sensex closes 331 points lower, Nifty below 26,000; BEL down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 331.21 points to close at 84,900.71, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 108.65 points to end at 25,959.50.

GST 2.0 is lifting consumption. Can it lift Sensex and Nifty too?GST 2.0 has pushed prices down and demand up, but whether that momentum can lift Sensex and Nifty will depend on earnings, capex and global stability in the months ahead.

Tejas crash at Dubai Airshow isolated occurrence: Read HAL's full statementAn Indian Air Force Tejas fighter jet crashed in the United Arab Emirates on Friday while taking part in the Dubai Airshow 2025.

Who is Rama Raju Mantena, pharma king behind Udaipur's star-studded wedding?Rama Raju Mantena is a well-known name in the US pharmaceutical industry. Originally from Vijayawada in Andhra Pradesh, Mantena moved to the United States in the 1980s.
HAL share price falls 4% after Tejas fighter jet crash at Dubai AirshowThe HAL stock slipped to around Rs 4,430, down roughly 3.6% at 10:44 am. Earlier in the day, the stock had tumbled over 8%.

Excelsoft Technologies IPO allotment out: Did you get shares? Check listing detailsExcelsoft Technologies IPO allotment: Applicants who subscribed to the IPO can check their status through the BSE website or the registrar, MUFG Intime India Pvt Ltd.

entertainment.headline: KBC 17: Will Smriti Mandhana be on show as women's cricket team shoots special? India's women cricketers is set to shoot for a special episode of Kaun Banega Crorepati today. And fans are now interested to know if Smriti Mandhana will appear on the show following a postponed wedding and family health emergencies.

Mammootty's Kalamkaval to clash with Ranveer's Dhurandhar. New release date out The crime thriller Kalamkaval, starring Mammootty, announces a new theatrical release date following a postponement, as its recent trailer draws attention for its intense storytelling and powerful performances.

Girija Oak on viral fame: I'm not getting extra work offers Actor Girija Oak discusses the consequences of sudden online fame following a viral interview, highlighting both the attention and the negative experiences she has faced on social media.

Sadie Sink shuts down marvel rumours: Hair colour can change, you know Sadie Sink discusses widespread rumours about her Marvel character following confirmation of her casting in Spider-Man: Brand New Day alongside Tom Holland and Zendaya.

Watch: Karan Aujla's Mumbai concert turns chaotic after Nigerian influencer brawl A physical altercation at Karan Aujla's November 23 concert in Mumbai's Loud Park, part of the Rolling Loud India festival, drew attention after Nigerian influencer Agu Stanley Chiedozie was involved in a heated fight with another attendee.

Rihanna cracks up at meme made from her unflattering photo on social media A meme featuring a candid photo of Rihanna from 2011 has prompted a direct response from the singer, leading to widespread discussion among fans on social media.

Amala Akkineni on her daughter-in-laws: Sobhita is independent, Zainab is warm Amala Akkineni opened up about her equation with her daughters-in-law Sobhita Dhulipala and Zainab Ravdjee, reflecting on the atmosphere of love, understanding, and religious diversity within the Akkineni family.

Jennifer Aniston styles her boyfriend Jim Curtis' hair, fans can't stop watching Jennifer Aniston shared a charming video on Instagram styling her boyfriend Jim Curtis's hair using her LolaVie products, delighting fans with this rare glimpse into their relationship. The couple recently made their first official public appearance, confirming their romance to the public.

Mahavatar Narsimha in race for Oscar shortlist in animated feature film category Mahavatar Narsimha, directed by Ashwin Kumar, is among 35 animated films eligible for consideration in the animated feature category at the 98th Academy Awards. The shortlist will be announced on December 16, as the film meets all required eligibility criteria for Oscar qualification.

How To Make A Killing trailer: Glen Powell plots for billions in dark comedy thriller A new trailer for the film How To Make A Killing, directed by John Patton Ford and starring Glen Powell, introduces audiences to a high-stakes story of inheritance, betrayal, and murder within a wealthy family.

Dhanush-Kriti Sanon's Tere Ishk Mein gets UA certificate, obscene word replaced The Central Board of Film Certification (CBFC) has cleared Aanand L Rai's 'Tere Ishk Mein' with a U/A 16+ certificate, requiring only a minor dialogue alteration, and confirmed its official runtime ahead of the film's global release.

Stranger Things 5: Season 4 ending explained and how it sets up Will's nightmare Stranger Things 5 is all set to release on Netflix, promising a thrilling conclusion to the intense battle that began in Season 4. The story delves deep into Vecna's sinister plans and Will Byers' pivotal role.

Netflix casts Toby Wallace as first lead in Assassin's Creed adaptation The Netflix adaptation of Assassin's Creed has cast Toby Wallace as its first series regular, marking the first major announcement for the live-action project.

Madelaine Petsch and Gavin Casalegno to star in Chasing Red film adaptation The upcoming film Chasing Red, starring Madelaine Petsch and Gavin Casalegno and based on the popular Wattpad webnovel, secures major international distribution ahead of release.

Wicked universe may grow bigger as Universal plans next steps Universal Pictures is considering expanding the Wicked franchise following the strong success of Wicked: For Good at the box office, with discussions underway for potential new film or television projects.

Rush Hour 4 back in development as Brett Ratner reboards franchise: Reports Paramount is developing a new Rush Hour sequel with Brett Ratner returning as director, after years of delays. The move reportedly follows Donald Trump's lobbying for the project, despite previous controversies surrounding Ratner. No official statements have been made by the director, the film's stars, or the studio about the sequel's progress.

Bigg Boss 19: Farrhana–Shehbaz fight injures Tanya as finale race intensifies The November 25 episode of Bigg Boss 19 turned intense after a heated clash between Farrhana and Shehbaz accidentally injured Tanya, just as wildcard contestants Malti and Shehbaz were cleared to join the Ticket to Finale race. With all housemates nominated, the competition has officially entered its most volatile phase ahead of the December 7 finale.

Shree Hanuman Chalisa becomes first Indian video to cross 5 billion views on YouTube 'Shree Hanuman Chalisa' has become the first Indian video to cross 5 billion views on YouTube, far ahead of all other Indian uploads. T-Series says the milestone reflects the devotion associated with the iconic devotional track featuring the late Gulshan Kumar.

Eva Green joins Wednesday Season 3 as Aunt Ophelia Eva Green has officially joined 'Wednesday' Season 3 as Aunt Ophelia, ending months of fan speculation after the mysterious character's Season 2 cliffhanger reveal. The new season will explore Ophelia's dark past, her psychic powers, and her chilling message: "Wednesday must die."

general news.headline: The 19 Bahadur: How CISF foiled Pakistan attack on Uri hydro plantOperation Sindoor: After India launched Operation Sindoor, Pakistan targeted the Uri hydroelectric power projects in Jammu and Kashmir. However, a CISF team of 19 foiled the Pakistani attack.

Put duties first for Viksit Bharat: PM's letter to citizens on Constitution Day"Every action of ours should strengthen the Constitution and further national goals and interests," PM Modi wrote in his letter to citizens on the occasion of India's 76th Constitution Day.

Chennai got 220,000 H-1B visas: US economist alleges massive fraud in India's capThe former US Representative alleged that the H-1B system had been "captured by industrial-scale fraud", asserting that visa allocations from India had reached levels that defied statutory limits.

2nd Test Day 5 Live: India in big trouble, Harmer takes fourIndia (IND) vs South Africa (SA) Live Score 2nd Test Day 5 Updates: Ravindra Jadeja is making a conscious effort to rotate the strike during his partnership with Sai Sudharsan, trying to keep the scoreboard moving as India stare at a looming crisis. With South Africa inching closer to a historic series whitewash on Indian soil, the pressure has intensified dramatically. India are reeling at five down, and Simon Harmer continues to weave his magic, tightening the noose with every over.

Pitbull attacks boy, bites off ear. This is exactly who should be punishedA neighbour's pitbull mauled a six-year-old boy grievously, detaching his ear, in Delhi. The pitbull is on the list of 24 dogs that the Centre had in March 2024 banned as pets. The ban has been stayed by the Karnataka High Court. But is banning breeds the answer to stopping attacks by pet dogs? Ultimately, who should be held responsible, and punished?

Cyclone Senyar forms over Strait of Malacca, heavy rain alert for regionCyclonic Storm Senyar formed over the Strait of Malacca after a deep depression intensified early Wednesday. IMD said the system will cross the Indonesia coast before weakening. A separate well-marked low is strengthening over the southwest Bay of Bengal.

Why Bihar is taking back Patna's 10 Circular Road from Lalu Yadav's familyThe Bihar government has reclaimed the iconic 10 Circular Road bungalow from the Lalu Prasad family after nearly two decades, marking a significant shift in the state's political landscape. This move reflects the strengthened position of the BJP and changing power dynamics in Bihar.

Teen dies in freak accident as basketball pole crushes him, tragedy on cameraThe incident occurred around 10 am at the sports ground in Haryana's Rohtak when the player was practising alone on the basketball court. The accident was captured on CCTV.

Trump Jr's India diary: Taj, temples, tigers and big Bollywood weddingDonald Trump Jr embarked on a dynamic week-long tour across India, engaging in heritage, conservation and high-profile events. His visit sparked social media buzz and hints at future business ties with Indian industrialists.

Sheikh Hasina's death sentence and politics of patienceThe death sentence awarded to Sheikh Hasina isn't a reason for the Awami League's political trajectory to change. The 76-year-old party remains remarkably steady and composed. By contrast, those who defeated the Awami League and came to power through an engineered process appear far more restless than necessary.

Outrage after Kali idol turned into Mother Mary at Mumbai temple; priest arrestedAn idol of Goddess Kali at a Mumbai temple was dressed to resemble Mother Mary. The priest has been arrested and a case under the charge of hurting religious sentiments has been registered.
Not clicked at comedy club: Kunal Kamra stirs fresh row with T-shirt mocking RSSComedian Kunal Kamra posts a photo allegedly mocking the RSS, drawing sharp criticism from BJP and Shiv Sena leaders.

KBC 17: Will Smriti Mandhana be on show as women's cricket team shoots special?India's women cricketers is set to shoot for a special episode of Kaun Banega Crorepati today. And fans are now interested to know if Smriti Mandhana will appear on the show following a postponed wedding and family health emergencies.
From Serenity to Celebration - Gujarat in All Its ShadesAnother destination that has stood the test of time and modernisation is Vadnagar.

Yamaha XSR155 review: Does it rekindle the legendary RX 100 spirit?Yamaha's latest XSR155 combines classic retro appeal with contemporary tech. It's a daring formula that raises expectations. But does it fulfil them all? Ride into our exclusive review.

HP to cut up to 6,000 jobs as it leans on AI: Full story in 5 pointsHP plans to cut 6,000 jobs globally by 2028 as part of a major restructuring drive. The move aims to boost AI integration and cost savings but raises concerns over rising memory chip costs and profit margins.

Dear brides, here's what your MUA is not telling you about coloured lensesIf you are a bride-to-be or someone who can't wait to glam up this wedding season, think twice before getting yourself coloured contact lenses.

Gautam Gambhir delivers fiery Day 5 pep talk as India fight to save Guwahati TestIndia head coach Gautam Gambhir delivered an intense pep talk before Day 5 of the 2nd Test against South Africa. India began the final day needing 522 runs to win while South Africa needed eight wickets to secure a historic 2-0 sweep of the series.

Fake degrees, political pressure: US diplomat exposes fraud in H-1B visa programmeIndian-American diplomat Mahvash Siddiqui has alleged rampant fraud in the H-1B visa system, claiming 80–90% of applications from India were fake. She says that during her tenure at the US Consulate in Chennai (2005–2007), officials repeatedly flagged the issue to Washington, but political pressure prevented any action.

CCTV shows car ramming ex-Shiv Sena MLA while she was walking on roadA former Shiv Sena MLA, Nirmala Gavit, was critically injured after being hit by a car while walking with her grandson in Nashik. The incident, captured on CCTV, has sparked outrage and raised serious questions about the missing driver and police action.

Bengaluru woman's midnight Rapido ride turns into tale of trust in her captainOn Instagram, Asha Mane shared a video documenting snippets from her 38-km Rapido journey, which she booked around 11:45 pm with just 6% phone battery left.

Attacked for neutral post on PM's speech: Shashi Tharoor's veiled dig at CongressCongress's Supriya Shrinate dismissed Shashi Tharoor's praise of PM Narendra Modi's Ramnath Goenka lecture, saying she found "nothing" in the speech worth appreciating. Senior Congress leader Sandeep Dikshit, meanwhile, wondered why Tharoor was in the party if he was impressed with the BJP and PM's strategies.

Self-evident fact: India jabs China's remarks on Arunachal after woman's detentionIndia has firmly protested against China after an Indian woman from Arunachal Pradesh was detained at Shanghai airport despite holding valid travel documents. New Delhi insists that Arunachal Pradesh is an integral part of India and demands an explanation from Beijing for violating international aviation norms.

Report claims Trump may fire Kash Patel as FBI chief, White House respondsMS NOW reports Trump is considering removing FBI Director Kash Patel amid growing frustration over controversies and may tap Andrew Bailey as successor. The White House denies the story as completely made up.

Andrea Jeremiah on Pisasu 2: There are erotic scenes in the film, but no nudityAndrea Jeremiah has addressed questions regarding the presence of nude scenes in Mysskin's film 'Pisasu 2', explaining that while the script originally included such scenes, they were ultimately not filmed.

Mammootty's Kalamkaval to clash with Ranveer's Dhurandhar. New release date outThe crime thriller Kalamkaval, starring Mammootty, announces a new theatrical release date following a postponement, as its recent trailer draws attention for its intense storytelling and powerful performances.

sports.headline: PSL turmoil: Multan Sultans owner quits amid rift with Pakistan Cricket Board PSL: Ali Khan Tareen has confirmed his departure as Multan Sultans owner following the PCB's decision not to offer a renewal. The move comes amid ongoing tensions, legal notices, and public criticism, leaving the franchise's future uncertain.

Caught on CCTV: National-level player dies after basketball hoop falls on him This report covers the death of 16-year-old national-level basketball player, Hardik, in a tragic accident in Lakhan Majra, Rohtak. The incident occurred when a basketball pole crashed down on him while he was practicing alone on the court. The event, captured on CCTV, has raised serious questions about the quality and safety of sports infrastructure in the state. According to India Today's Aman Bharadwaj, 'people and sportsmen do question that how come the preparations being made, the infrastructure is being established, that the pole or the things in the basketball court, they are taking lives.' This is reportedly the second such incident in Haryana in a week, following a similar death in Bahadurgarh.

Gautam Gambhir delivers fiery Day 5 pep talk as India fight to save Guwahati Test India head coach Gautam Gambhir delivered an intense pep talk before Day 5 of the 2nd Test against South Africa. India began the final day needing 522 runs to win while South Africa needed eight wickets to secure a historic 2-0 sweep of the series.

Champions League: Chelsea thrash Barcelona, Leverkusen stun Manchester City Champions League: Defensive lapses cost Manchester City and Barcelona dearly as both teams slumped to notable losses on Tuesday, undoing promising starts and leaving both giants facing growing scrutiny in the league phase.

How Yashasvi can learn from Sachin Tendulkar's SCG masterclass to regain form IND vs SA: Yashasvi Jaiswal's issues against left-arm seamers have resurfaced, with Marco Jansen removing him three times in four innings in the ongoing Test series, firmly exposing a growing weakness.

2nd Test Day 5 Live: India in big trouble, Harmer takes four India (IND) vs South Africa (SA) Live Score 2nd Test Day 5 Updates: India are in all sorts of trouble with five wickets down. Simon Harmer is spinning a web here as India lose Rishabh Pant next. Ravindra Jadeja has joined Sai Sudharshan in the middle with South Africa inching closer to a historic series whitewash in India.

Gambhir doing his job, but players need belief: Raina defends India coach IND vs SA: Suresh Raina has backed Gautam Gambhir at a time when results have placed the Indian coach firmly under the scanner. For Raina, the real fix lies with the players rediscovering belief and responsibility at the crease.

India must focus on batting well, not the target: Pujara's advice for Guwahati Test IND vs SA: Cheteshwar Pujara has urged India to shift their focus from the target and concentrate on batting properly in Guwahati. India have been left with the daunting task of attempting a chase of 549 to save the series
Bret Hart alleges sexual relationship between Shawn Michaels and Vince McMahon Bret Hart's allegation has once again put Shawn Michaels and Vince McMahon under an intense spotlight.

Trusting our defence will be key: Ravindra Jadeja hopes India save Guwahati Test IND vs SA, 2nd Test: In the press conference after the fourth day's play, Ravindra Jadeja said that India have a decent chance of drawing the second Test against South Africa if they manage to show effectiveness with their defensive game on Wednesday.

India vs Australia in Ahmedabad: Surya picks T20 World Cup finalists, sledges RohitSuryakumar Yadav boldly named Australia as India's preferred T20 World Cup final opponents, even as Rohit Sharma stressed he simply wants India to reach the summit and come out on top against any team.

Men's T20 World Cup 2026: Complete India schedule for mega eventIndia will begin their campaign in the Men's T20 World Cup 2026 against the United States on February 7 with their marquee clash against Pakistan on February 15 in Colombo.

T20 World Cup 2026: Chinnaswamy dropped again, Bengaluru remains off hosting dutiesThe M Chinnaswamy Stadium has once again been excluded from a major ICC event, with Bengaluru missing out on hosting duties for the T20 World Cup 2026. The omission comes months after the IPL 2025 stampede and follows similar venue changes during the Women's World Cup 2025.

T20 World Cup 2026 schedule: Check venue, date for IND vs PAK matchThe ICC announced the full schedule and venues of the upcoming T20 World Cup 2026. The headlining fixture that is India vs Pakistan is set to be played on February 15 in Colombo, Sri Lanka.

Rohit Sharma named tournament ambassador for Men's T20 World Cup 2026Rohit Sharma has been named the tournament ambassador for the Men's T20 World Cup 2026. ICC chairman Jay Shah made the announcement at an event in Mumbai on Tuesday, November 25, where the tournament schedule was also unveiled.

Wanted India to grovel: South Africa coach makes controversial remark in GuwahatiIND vs SA: South Africa coach Shukri Conrad sparked outrage in Guwahati after declaring he wanted India to "grovel", reigniting a historically loaded and provocative term in the wake of his side's dominant display on Day 4 of the second Test.

Want to see real fightback and determination from Indian batters: Parthiv PatelParthiv Patel has urged the Indian batters to show fight and discipline on the final day of the Guwahati Test, with the hosts needing 522 runs to avoid a 0-2 whitewash against South Africa. He stressed technique, resilience and smart decision-making on a turning pitch.

Watch: Anil Kumble's reaction to KL Rahul getting bowled by Simon Harmer in Guwahati goes viralAnil Kumble's reaction in the commentary box went viral after KL Rahul was bowled by Simon Harmer on Day 4 of the Guwahati Test. The former India captain criticised Rahul's technique as India slipped deeper into trouble and edged closer to another home whitewash.

The former India captain criticised Rahul's technique as India slipped deeper into trouble and edged closer to another home whitewash.

Did Virat Kohli's brother slam Gambhir for Test dip? Happens when you boss aroundIND vs SA: Vikas Kohli's jibe has added to the pressure on Gautam Gambhir as India struggle in Guwahati. Questions around leadership are now unavoidable.

Sri Lanka vs Zimbabwe, T20I tri-series, Match 5: Highlights from RawalpindiSL vs ZIM, T20I tri-series, Match 5 Highlights: Zimbabwe have won the toss and opted to bat first. Sikandar Raza's men will join Pakistan in the final if they beat Sri Lanka on Tuesday.

Draw in Guwahati Test as good as a win: Ravindra JadejaIND vs SA: Ravindra Jadeja said that managing to draw the Guwahati Test would be as good as a win for India, who ended Day 4 at 27 for two while chasing 549. India are looking to avoid a series defeat, having already lost the Kolkata Test earlier.

Watch: Virat Kohli arrives in Mumbai ahead of South Africa ODI seriesVirat Kohli has arrived in Mumbai ahead of India's ODI series against South Africa, entering with confidence after an unbeaten 74 against Australia. With KL Rahul leading in Shubman Gill's absence, India hopes to bounce back following a disappointing Test run.

Early blows in 549 chase kill hopes of draw as India face another home whitewashIndia vs South Africa, 2nd Test: South Africa tightened their grip on the Guwahti encounter as India wilted in the field with both bat and ball. After setting a 549-run target, South Africa dismissed Indian openers KL Rahul and Yashasvi Jaiswal, leaving the hosts reeling at 27 for 2.

England should have handled Travis Head better: Stuart Broad explains howAshes 2025: Travis Head's blistering 123 off just 83 balls sealed a two-day win for Australia in Perth. Now, Stuart Broad has revealed the tactical errors that allowed the left-hander to run riot unchecked.

Test struggles not Gauti bhaiya's fault, he loves the Indian team: Suresh RainaIndia vs South Africa: Former India all-rounder Suresh Raina defended Gautam Gambhir, saying it's unfair to blame the head coach for batting failures in Test cricket. India are staring a 0-2 series defeat against South Africa in Guwahati.

Prithvi Shaw eyes IPL return, set to lead Maharashtra in Syed Mushtaq Ali TrophyPrithvi Shaw begins a fresh chapter with Maharashtra as he looks to revive his career in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy. With the IPL auction approaching, a strong performance while leading the side in Gaikwad's absence could help him return to the league.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
